DOC.brief_title: The Impact Text Messaging Medication Adherence Exercise Regimen Among Post-myocardial Infarction Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The Impact Text Messaging Medication Adherence Exercise Regimen among Post-Myocardial Infarction Patients include two single-center randomize control trial assess impact text message remind adherence medication exercise regimen patient recently discharge hospital MI . Recruitment conduct Cambridge Cardiac Rehabilitation Ontario , Canada medication adherence exercise trial . Potential study subject evaluate inclusion exclusion criterion , give write informed consent , randomize , 1:1 ratio , either intervention usual care ( control ) . Patients randomize intervention arm medication adherence trial receive automate text message per day time prescribed take medication . The text message contain personal pharmacological information . Patients randomize intervention arm exercise adherence trial receive four text message per day 7:30 , 12:00 pm , 6:00 pm , 9:00 pm , remind exercise 30 minute per day per health care provider .
DOC.criteria: PostMI hospital discharge within 2 week Enrolled cardiac rehabilitation Prescribed antiplatelets , betablockers , ACEinhibitors ARBs , and/or statin 1x/day regimen ( medication adherence trial ) Prescribed exercise regimen ( exercise trial ) Ability read write English Possession cell phone text messaging capability Age < 18 Incarcerated individual Unable read write English Not possession cell phone Patients prescribed medication regimen > 1x/day
